Typedef Documentation

typedef struct lspg_getcenter_struct lspg_getcenter_t

Storage for getcenter query Used for the md2 ROTATE command that generates the centering movies.

typedef struct lspg_nextshot_struct lspg_nextshot_t

Storage definition for nextshot query.

The next shot query returns all the information needed to collect the next data frame. Since SQL allows for null fields independently from blank strings a separate integer is used as a flag for this case. This adds to the program complexity but allows for some important cases. Suck it up. definition of the next image to be taken (and the one after that, too!)

typedef struct lspmac_motor_struct lspmac_motor_t

Motor information.

A catchall for motors and motor like objects. Not all members are used by all objects.

typedef struct lspmac_cmd_queue_struct pmac_cmd_queue_t

PMAC command queue item.

Command queue items are fixed length to simplify memory management.

typedef struct tagEthernetCmd pmac_cmd_t

PMAC ethernet packet definition.

Taken directly from the Delta Tau documentation.

void lsevents_remove_listener ( char *  ,
void(*)(char *)  cb 
)

Definition at line 83 of file lsevents.c.

00083                                                                 {
00084   
00085   lsevents_listener_t *last, *current;
00086 
00087   //
00088   // Find the listener to remove
00089   // and unlink it from the list
00090   //
00091   pthread_mutex_lock( &lsevents_listener_mutex);
00092   last = NULL;
00093   for( current = lsevents_listeners_p; current != NULL; current = current->next) {
00094     if( strcmp( last->event, event) == 0 && last->cb == cb) {
00095       if( last == NULL) {
00096         lsevents_listeners_p = current->next;
00097       } else {
00098         last->next = current->next;
00099       }
00100       break;
00101     }
00102   }
00103   pthread_mutex_unlock( &lsevents_listener_mutex);
00104 
00105   //
00106   // Now remove it
00107   // TODO: use saner memory management where we allocate many listeners at a time
00108   // as an array and then just flag the ones that are used
00109   //
00110   if( current != NULL) {
00111     if( current->event != NULL)
00112       free( current->event);
00113     free(current);
00114   }
00115 }

Definition at line 41 of file lstimer.c.

00041                                                                                                  {
00042   int i;
00043   struct timespec now;
00044 
00045   //
00046   // Time we were called.  Delay is based on call time, not queued time
00047   //
00048   clock_gettime( CLOCK_REALTIME, &now);
00049   
00050 
00051   pthread_mutex_lock( &lstimer_mutex);
00052 
00053   for( i=0; i<LSTIMER_LIST_LENGTH; i++) {
00054     if( lstimer_list[i].shots == 0)
00055       break;
00056   }
00057 
00058   if( i == LSTIMER_LIST_LENGTH) {
00059     pthread_mutex_unlock( &lstimer_mutex);
00060     
00061     lslogging_log_message( "lstimer_add_timer: out of timers for event: %s, shots: %d,  secs: %u, nsecs: %u",
00062                           event, shots, secs, nsecs);
00063     return;
00064   }
00065 
00066   strncpy( lstimer_list[i].event, event, LSEVENTS_EVENT_LENGTH - 1);
00067   lstimer_list[i].event[LSEVENTS_EVENT_LENGTH - 1] = 0;
00068   lstimer_list[i].shots        = shots;
00069   lstimer_list[i].delay_secs   = secs;
00070   lstimer_list[i].delay_nsecs  = nsecs;
00071 
00072   lstimer_list[i].next_secs    = secs + now.tv_sec + (now.tv_nsec + nsecs) / 1000000000;
00073   lstimer_list[i].next_nsecs   = (now.tv_nsec + nsecs) % 1000000000;
00074   lstimer_list[i].last_secs    = 0;
00075   lstimer_list[i].last_nsecs   = 0;
00076   
00077   lstimer_list[i].ncalls       = 0;
00078   lstimer_list[i].init_secs    = now.tv_sec;
00079   lstimer_list[i].init_nsecs   = now.tv_nsec;
00080 
00081   if( shots != 0) {
00082     lstimer_active_timers++;
00083     new_timer++;
00084   }
00085 
00086   pthread_cond_signal(  &lstimer_cond);
00087   pthread_mutex_unlock( &lstimer_mutex);
00088 }
